turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Good. Um, my name is Doctor Gohil. I'm one of the physicians that works here at Babylon.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: May I confirm your name and date of birth, please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, uh, my name is Sarah Smith. And, my date of birth is the twentieth of April nineteen eighty.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Nineteen eighty three. And, are you in a space that's private and quiet, and you can talk?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Good. So, it says, erm, I've got a note to say, it says you're feeling short of breath. Is that correct?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Are you able to tell me a little bit more about that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah. I was watching TV and, um, just like over the last hour, I've started to feel, like, a bit short of breath.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That is, while you're sitting watching TV?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, have you noticed anything like this before?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, apart from the shortness of breath, have you noticed anything else?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so, I <UNIN/>, I started with a cough yesterday.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah. I, I don't know if it's, um, relevant, but I had a C-section a few weeks ago.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, how long ago was that? Just a few weeks?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, are you with baby at the moment?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Any coughs or colds with, uh, them?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, you've noticed shortness of breath for just an hour, while sitting <UNSURE>and</UNSURE> watching TV?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, you had your C-section a couple of weeks ago?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, yesterday you noticed a cough?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, talk to me about the cough. Have you bought anything up?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, when was the last time you were ill with the flu, or symptoms like this?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, you know, I get coughs and colds quite a lot, but probably.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, this shortness of breath you're having, is it getting worse?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No. I mean, I don't know. I feel like I'm getting really stressed out because, like, my heart, it's really going.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, you're feeling your heart more than normal?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, the shortness of breath, does it cause any pain in your chest?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: How about when you take a very deep breath in?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I mean, yeah. My chest feels sore, but so does my C-section scar. You know, it's, it's all tender.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, since your C-section, did you have to take any medications?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>All right.</UNSURE> And, can you remember what the name of those were?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, they gave me some, uh, Codeine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, have you had to use that regularly?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah. I, I've been taking that fairly, fairly regularly. But, probably haven't taken it for a week.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, apart from the C-section and the shortness of breath, have you got any other medical problems I should know about?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> tell you, I'm allergic to Ibuprofen, though.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, what happens when you take Ibuprofen?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, I need you to do something for me. Have you measured the rate of your heart before?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Have you measured it recently, either with an iWatch or something similar?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. We might need to do that over the phone. So, are you able to put your right hand on your left wrist, just underneath your thumb? And, see if <UNSURE>you can</UNSURE> feel your heartbeat.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, uh, what I need you to do is, when I count to three, count down from three, just <UNIN/> count the number of beats you've noticed. And, I'll tell you when to stop. Is that OK?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, we'll start in three, two, one. Go.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Great. That should be enough. How many did you count?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, your heart is running slightly fast at the moment, which is probably because of the shortness of breath and some of the pain that you're under.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Given that you've had a C-section, and you're short of breath, which has come on quite recently and quite quickly

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: It might be worth you going into the hospital to get checked out the bit further.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, there's two ways of us doing this. The first is, I can call an ambulance. Or, you can take yourself to the hospital with baby.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, it feels a bit dramatic to call an ambulance. Um, I, I will, I will go. I will, I will take myself.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure. And, what I would suggest is, go fairly quickly and take some bits for baby at the same time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, if you're taking any medications like Codeine, don't, don't take them for the time being.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is anyone else with you at home?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no. My partner's at work.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, I think that's the best thing to do, for the time being.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, what I'm worried about at the moment is, given that you've had a C-section

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Some people can suffer with clots. And, those can either be found in the legs or your chest, so in your lungs.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: It's quite a common thing to happen. And, it's not something to worry about. But, needs to be checked out in the hospital first.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, if it, if that does become the case, they can give you something to reduce the clot.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK. Yeah. I mean, my mum's had, uh, clots in her legs before. So, I guess, you know.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> Yeah, that makes sense. I know, I know what they are.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Good. Are you, uh, are you particularly worried about anything, or do you want to ask me anything, before we go?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, no. I'm fine. I'll, uh, I'll just take myself to the hospital.
